website_summaries.verdict: Choose this one if a streamlined design is your top concern, and you spend most of your time outdoors in the winter. If not, check out the other models we considered.
pros: Designed for winter activities such skiing, snowboarding, and hiking on snow-covered trails thanks to the lightweight, low-profile design
Features a pocket for several small essentials
cons: The trade off for the less bulky build is that it holds less water than most by the brand – about 2 liters
Bladder is somewhat difficult to fill

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed Poorly sized
customer_reviews.text: Poorly engineered. This was supposed to be a replacement for my 10 year old Camelbak because my tube kept freezing on the mountain while snowboarding. The tube on this model is almost a foot too short and has no clip to secure it to the backpack. The backpack itself appears to be sized for toddlers as it was waaaay too small for me and I’m not that big. My other unit fit great, what happened? This will either be returned or given to one of our three year old grandsons.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect snow skiing back pack!
customer_reviews.text: the fit was perfect it never bothered me on my back while snow skiing! Nothing about this ski pack that I didn't like. Perfect amount of room for all my nicknacks while spending a full day on the slopes. It holds more than enough water for the day. An added plus is that you can adjust the water amount in the bladder by not filling it up all the way to allow for more room for your supplies. I dont know how I lived all these years with out this?!
customer_reviews.author: christopher r matthes

customer_reviews.title: Hydration on the go
customer_reviews.text: Camelback is generally a very trusted name in the game, this hydration pack continues that legacy. I have only worn this skiing but it really made a difference for a few reasons. 1) It's a good way to hang on to keys and wallet, however annoyingly my Iphone 7s is a bit too big - but i prefer to keep that in my jacket pocket anyways. 2) Hydration on the slopes makes such a difference, and the water does not freeze. 3) You dont even feel it on your back when skiing or on the lifts. A minor complaint is that it is a little finnicky getting the full bladder into the pack but nothing that cant be done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and slim enough to easy fit on the chair lift
customer_reviews.text: Works very well! Only had minor freezing issues on the REALLY cold days, and that was because I forgot to blow out the water line when done. Very large reservoir, and slim enough to easy fit on the chair lift. Only complaint is the difficulty of getting a full bladder into the bag because of how slim form factor the bag is.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good, but old version is better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because I owned a previous version of the zoid and loved that one. This new one has a few new changes. 1. The tube valve has the new improved design. 2. the water bladder uses a different type of hook. #2 was a bad change, it made it very VERY difficult to remove the bladder to refill water. The original design is way superior, I'm not sure why this decision was made. If this was the only change, I would have given it just 3 stars. I added one star back for the valve upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zheng

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has not frozen down to single digit temps and it fits good. It is very cumbersome to remove the bladder from and place into the backpack. They should have used Velcro to secure the tube in the pack and the retainer for the bladder is more difficult to use that it should be. The zipper to access the tube should have some mitten friendly grip. The tube needs to be in the pocket to keep it from freezing,
customer_reviews.author: C. Pahl

customer_reviews.title: Great for Skiing and Outdoor Adventures
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! My son used this for skiing in Breckenridge to stay hydrated on the slopes all day. The bladder takes a bit of getting used too, but once you get the hang of it, it's great. The color is a cherry red. I imagine he'll continue to use this as we hike and bike parks in warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for skiing and fat biking
customer_reviews.text: Low profile is perfect for ski lifts and insulation keeps hose from freezing in extreme cold.
customer_reviews.author: Nashuaslick

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER FIRST USE!!!!! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed in this camelbak. I’ve had another brand hydropack for 10 years, and after the first use this camelback is unusable. The pocket for the water reservoir is too tight against the bladder, and upon taking it out of the pack to fill it, the bladder caught a zipper and completely ripped open the entire thing. I think this design is very flawed, I don’t even want another to replace it, I want my money back. The only way I would stay with this company is if they have some kick ass customer service because this is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Skiing. Very durable. Have taken two violent hard hits on it. One cost me a helmet. Camelback Probably saved me some as it cushioned the impacts. Ended up in hospital with internal injuries on second hit. Bladder held up both times without any leaks in spite of taking on my body weight from height. Holds enough water for high altitudes and slim design works well on lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Stan M.

customer_reviews.title: ... it on a 6 hour hike and it was great! Very light so it was easy to carry ...
customer_reviews.text: Took it on a 6 hour hike and it was great! Very light so it was easy to carry but held enough water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water leaks
customer_reviews.text: At first it looked like a good product and it held water just fine. As soon as I started to drink out of it, it started leaking. When I take the hydration pack out of the bag, it's fine, but once you put it back in the bag it started leaking again. Not sure if it has to do with pressure. Don't spend $70 on a leaking hydration pack. You'll end up wasting a lot of water too.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, but I am a tall guy and ...
customer_reviews.text: Good pack, but I am a tall guy and the pack didn't work for my size. It seems like it was designed for shorter people, if I had the shoulder straps in a comfortable position then the drinking tube was really high on my shoulder. I gave it to my son and he really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K

customer_reviews.title: Nice small under jacket winter water pack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for under jacket. Zip pocket is big enough for wallet, snack and spare liners but too short for larger phones, like Samsung Note. Good for cycling and skiing. Gripe: it needs a chest strap between shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Doner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of camelbak. I have 2 of their bags. Got this for snowboarding. I got so frustrated with the design. The way the reservoir is suspended makes it almost impossible to insert or remove from the bag to clean or refill... A Definite deal breaker....
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: High quality, little small poket
customer_reviews.text: Very High Quality, the second pocet is a bit small.. can fit keys, wallet. My Xiaomi mi note 2 is too big to fit in :( Need to firmly close the water bag for no leeks. Overall very satisfied from the bag, slim fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ofir Gan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. LEAKS!!
customer_reviews.text: HATE this product. Mine was delivered broken and now I can't use it. The water leaks out...it is the worst product on the market. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Schmid

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Got my first one and it leaked
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Got my first one and it leaked. I really liked the design so I returned it and got the same one again. I’ve now been walking around a music festival all weekend with the new pack leaking all over me.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: It LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: I would give theis product 0 stars if I could. This is the second Zoid I have ordered, and both leaked. The gasket is way oversized and does not seal the twist top. Do NOT buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Friel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: But it's little small so I returned it, no much space to put sandwiches, walkie talkies..etc
customer_reviews.author: Saf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for skiing. Holds more water than you need. Also can fit keys and a few granola bars. Don’t know how we skied without it
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Good for skiing
customer_reviews.text: Went skiing with the pack. No freezing of any sort for an entire day.
customer_reviews.author: Zhouyang Lian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for snowboarding / skiing. Defiantly worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this snowboarding. Kept me hydrated without getting in the way. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Zach Renshaw

customer_reviews.title: Great water bag.  Finally no need to carry a water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Pocket is not so big as I wanted but main purpose of water bag is great. Used it this weekend and loved it. People were asking about it. Great impression
customer_reviews.author: Cindy & Jose

customer_reviews.title: Leakage Issues - Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Leaked upon filling it up for the first time from BOTH ends. Water was squirting out everywhere. Didn’t even get to use the pack for what I intended in fear all of the water would leak out during my exercise, thus putting me in a sketchy situation.
customer_reviews.author: DPR

product_meta.title: CamelBak Zoid Ski Hydration Pack, 70oz
feature_bullets: Designed to Carry: Snack, phone, wallet, keys
The Crux Reservoir delivers 20% more water per sip, with an ergonomic handle for easier refilling, and an on/off lever that makes it easy to prevent leaks
